com.apriori.concurrent

Class ManagedBlockers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.concurrent.ManagedBlockers

  • public final class ManagedBlockers
extends Object
    Numerous utility methods related to blocking using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier<T>
      Like a Supplier, except allowed to throw an InterruptedException.
      static interface  ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleSupplier<T>
      Similar to ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier, but accepts a time limit argument and can throw a TimeoutException if the given time limit elapses before the result value is available.
      static interface  ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleWait
      A function that waits up to a given limit for some event.

    • Method Detail

      • blockUninterruptibly

        public static void blockUninterruptibly(ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker blocker)
        Blocks using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker in a non-interruptible way. If the thread is interrupted while blocking, it will be ignored and blocking will continue. If interrupted, the interrupt status on the thread is restored before this method returns.
        Parameters:
        blocker - the blocker used to block the current thread

      • managedBlockFor

        public static <T> T managedBlockFor(ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier<T> supplier)
                             throws InterruptedException
        Performs a managed block to get a value from the given supplier. The given supplier is allowed (expected actually) to block.
        Parameters:
        supplier - a supplier that blocks to produce a value
        Returns:
        the value returned from the given supplier
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the result

      • managedBlockUninterruptiblyFor

        public static <T> T managedBlockUninterruptiblyFor(ManagedBlockers.InterruptibleSupplier<T> supplier)
        Performs an uninterruptible managed block to get a value from the given supplier. The given supplier is allowed (expected actually) to block.
        Parameters:
        supplier - a supplier that blocks to produce a value
        Returns:
        the value returned from the given supplier

      • managedTimedBlockFor

        public static <T> T managedTimedBlockFor(ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleSupplier<T> supplier,
                                         long timeLimit,
                                         TimeUnit unit)
                                  throws InterruptedException,
                                         TimeoutException
        Performs a managed block, up to a given time limit, to get a value from the given supplier. The given supplier is allowed (expected actually) to block.

        The given supplier is expected to handle the time limit itself by respecting the argument passed to it. That argument will be the number of nanoseconds it has to complete. It should throw a TimeoutException if it cannot return a result in time.

        Parameters:
        supplier - a supplier that blocks to produce a value
        timeLimit - the time limit to wait for the value
        unit - the unit of the given time limit
        Returns:
        the value returned from the given supplier
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the result
        TimeoutException - if the given time limit elapses before a result is returned

      • managedTimedWait

        public static boolean managedTimedWait(ManagedBlockers.TimedInterruptibleWait waiter,
                                       long timeLimit,
                                       TimeUnit unit)
                                throws InterruptedException
        Performs a managed block, up to a given time limit, for some event. The given function should return true if the event occurs or false if the time limit elapsed first.

        The given function is expected to handle the time limit itself by respecting the argument passed to it. That argument will be the number of nanoseconds it has to complete. It should return false if that elapses before the event for which it is waiting.

        Parameters:
        waiter - a function that waits until an event occurs
        timeLimit - the time limit to wait for the value
        unit - the unit of the given time limit
        Returns:
        true if the event occurred or false if the time limit elapsed first
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting for the result

      • managedAwait

        public static void managedAwait(Awaitable awaitable)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Awaits an Awaitable using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls awaitable.await(), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        awaitable - an awaitable
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Awaitable)

      • managedAwait

        public static boolean managedAwait(Awaitable awaitable,
                                   long timeLimit,
                                   TimeUnit unit)
                            throws InterruptedException
        Awaits an Awaitable up to the given time limit using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls awaitable.await(timeLimit, unit), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        awaitable - an awaitable
        timeLimit - the limit on the time to wait
        unit - the unit of the given time limit
        Returns:
        true if the awaitable completed or false if the time limit elapsed first
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Awaitable)

      • managedAwaitUninterruptibly

        public static void managedAwaitUninterruptibly(Awaitable awaitable)
        Awaits an Awaitable in an uninterruptible way, using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls awaitable.awaitUninterruptibly(), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        awaitable - an awaitable
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Awaitable)

      • managedLock

        public static void managedLock(Lock lock)
        Acquires a lock using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls lock.lock(), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        lock - a lock
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Lock)

      • managedLockInterruptibly

        public static void managedLockInterruptibly(Lock lock)
                                     throws InterruptedException
        Acquires a lock, allowing interruptions, using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls lock.lockInterruptibly(), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        lock - a lock
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting to acquire
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Lock)

      • managedTryLock

        public static boolean managedTryLock(Lock lock,
                                     long timeLimit,
                                     TimeUnit unit)
                              throws InterruptedException
        Acquires a lock, waiting up to the given time limit, using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls lock.tryLock(timeLimit, unit), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        lock - a lock
        timeLimit - the limit on the time to wait for acquisition
        unit - the unit of the given time limit
        Returns:
        true if the lock was acquired or false if the time limit elapsed first
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting to acquire
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Lock)

      • managedConditionAwait

        public static void managedConditionAwait(Condition condition)
                                  throws InterruptedException
        Awaits a Condition using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls condition.await(), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        condition - a condition
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Condition)

      • managedConditionAwait

        public static boolean managedConditionAwait(Condition condition,
                                            long timeLimit,
                                            TimeUnit unit)
                                     throws InterruptedException
        Awaits a Condition up to the given time limit using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls condition.await(timeLimit, unit), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        condition - a condition
        timeLimit - the limit on the time to wait
        unit - the unit of the given time limit
        Returns:
        true if the condition signaled or false if the time limit elapsed first
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted while waiting
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Condition)

      • managedConditionAwaitUninterruptibly

        public static void managedConditionAwaitUninterruptibly(Condition condition)
        Awaits a Condition in an uninterruptible way, using a ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlocker. This effectively calls condition.awaitUninterruptibly(), but in a managed way that can be invoked from a ForkJoinPool.
        Parameters:
        condition - a condition
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Condition)

      • makeManaged

        public static Awaitable makeManaged(Awaitable awaitable)
        Returns a version of the given awaitable that uses ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for all blocking operations.
        Parameters:
        awaitable - an awaitable
        Returns:
        an awaitable that delegates all calls to the given awaitable, except for using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for any blocking operations

      • makeManaged

        public static Lock makeManaged(Lock lock)
        Returns a version of the given lock that uses ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for all blocking operations. Any conditions created by the returned lock also use ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for blocking operations.
        Parameters:
        lock - a lock
        Returns:
        an lock that delegates all calls to the given lock, except for using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for any blocking operations
        See Also:
        makeManaged(Condition)

      • makeManaged

        public static Condition makeManaged(Condition condition)
        Returns a version of the given condition that uses ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for all blocking operations.
        Parameters:
        condition - a condition
        Returns:
        an condition that delegates all calls to the given condition, except for using ForkJoinPool.ManagedBlockers for any blocking operations
